channel.title: math.GT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Instanton Floer homology and Milnor Fibers
item.description: arXiv:2410.16584v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In the early days of the Floer theory, Atiyah asked if there is a Milnor fiber description of the Floer homology of the links of singularities. We answer this question for the Brieskorn-Hamm complete intersection singularities. The resulting combinatorial formulas lead to an independent proof of the equality of the Casson invariants in the Donaldson and Seiberg-Witten theories. We use similar techniques to express the Heegaard Floer d-invariant of torus knots in terms of their Milnor fibers.
item.dc:creator: Kyoung-Seog Lee, Anatoly Libgober, Nikolai Saveliev

item.title: On elliptic surfaces which have no 1-handles
item.description: arXiv:2410.16900v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Gompf conjectured that the elliptic surface $E(n)_{p,q}$ has no handle decomposition without 1- and 3-handles. We prove that each of the elliptic surfaces $E(n)_{5,6}$, $E(n)_{6,7}$, $E(n)_{7,8}$ and $E(n)_{8,9}$ has a handle decomposition without 1-handles for $n\geq4$, $n\geq 5$, $n\geq 9$ and $n\geq 24$, respectively.
item.dc:creator: Daisuke Kusuda

item.title: Connectivity of partial basis complexes of freely decomposable groups
item.description: arXiv:2410.17121v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We show that the complex of partial bases of the free group of rank $n$, where vertices are seen up to conjugation, is Cohen--Macaulay of dimension $n-1$. This positively answers a conjecture raised by Day and Putman. We prove our results in the more general context of freely decomposable groups.
item.dc:creator: Benjamin Br\"uck, Kevin Ivan Piterman

item.title: Asphericity of cubical presentations: the general case
item.description: arXiv:2410.16390v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We show that, under suitable hypotheses, the coned-off spaces associated to $C(9)$ cubical small-cancellation presentations are aspherical, and use this to provide classifying spaces, or classifying spaces for proper actions, for their fundamental groups. Along the way, we show that the Cohen--Lyndon property holds for the subgroups of the fundamental group of a non-positively curved cube complex associated to a $C(9)$ cubical presentation, and thus obtain near-sharp upper and lower bounds for the (rational) cohomological dimension of these quotients. We apply these results to give an alternative construction of compact $K(\pi,1)$ for Artin groups with no labels in $\{3,4\}$, from which a new direct sum decomposition for their homology and cohomology with various coefficients above a certain dimension follows. We also address a question of Wise about the virtual torsion-freeness of cubical small-cancellation groups.
item.dc:creator: Macarena Arenas

item.title: Linking numbers and non-holomorphic Siegel modular forms
item.description: arXiv:2410.17231v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We study generating series encoding linking numbers between geodesics in arithmetic hyperbolic $3$-folds. We show that the series converge to functions on the genus $2$ Siegel upper-half plane and that certain explicit modifications have the transformation properties of genus $2$ Siegel modular forms of weight $2$. This is done by carefully analysing the integral of the Kudla-Millson theta series over a surface with geodesic boundary.
item.dc:creator: Mads Bjerge Christensen

item.title: Minimal stretch factors of orientation-reversing fully-punctured pseudo-Anosov maps
item.description: arXiv:2402.15369v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We show that the stretch factor $\lambda(f)$ of an orientation-reversing fully-punctured pseudo-Anosov map $f$ on a finite-type orientable surface $S$, with $-\chi(S) \geq 4$ and having at least two puncture orbits, satisfies the inequality $\lambda(f)^{-\chi(S)} \geq \sigma^2$, where $\sigma=1+\sqrt{2}$ is the silver ratio. We provide examples showing that this bound is asymptotically sharp. This extends previous results of Hironaka and the third author to orientation-reversing maps.
item.dc:creator: Erwan Lanneau, Livio Liechti, Chi Cheuk Tsang

item.title: Detection of twice-punctured tori in hyperbolic knot complements
item.description: arXiv:2404.06388v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We extend the methods of the author's previous paper to show that certain families of essential twice-punctured tori are detected by an ideal point on the character variety, and that the limiting character at these ideal points is irreducible. This completes the proof that all punctured tori in two-bridge knots are detected by an ideal point in the $SL_2(\mathbb{C})$ character variety and initiates the study of punctured tori in pretzel knots.
item.dc:creator: Yi Wang

item.title: Relative train tracks and endperiodic graph maps
item.description: arXiv:2408.13401v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We study endperiodic maps of an infinite graph with finitely many ends. We prove that any such map is homotopic to an endperiodic relative train track map. Moreover, we show that the (largest) Perron-Frobenius eigenvalue of the transition matrix is a canonical quantity associated to the map.
item.dc:creator: Yan Mary He, Chenxi Wu

item.title: Clock Moves and Alexander Polynomial of Plane Graphs
item.description: arXiv:2410.16126v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this paper, we introduce a notion of clock moves for spanning trees in plane graphs. This enables us to develop a spanning tree model of an Alexander polynomial for a plane graph and prove the unimodal property of its associate coefficient sequence. In particular, this confirms the trapezoidal conjecture for planar singular knots and gives new insights to Fox's original conjecture on alternating knots.
item.dc:creator: Wenbo Liao, Zhongtao Wu
